description: Debates erupt in neighborhoods and bars about the future—abolition or autonomy—spotlighting irreconcilable visions for Stenograd.
Rada convenes a meeting with returnees and analog resistance leaders, drafting a public declaration that stakes out the right to disconnect and encourages neighborhoods to mark their autonomy.
The declaration circulates citywide; families and districts mark chalk symbols to opt out, launching the birth of coexisting digital and analog communities.
